intro: Xyris byssacea, commonly known as the swamp lily, is a flowering plant native to wetland habitats in the southeastern United States. It belongs to the genus Xyris, which includes approximately 200 species of flowering plants. The plant typically grows in marshy areas and is characterized by its grass-like leaves and showy yellow flowers. Xyris byssacea has a rhizomatous root system that helps it thrive in saturated soil conditions. Its botanical features make it an important component of wetland ecosystems.
